Functionality¶

Module: api¶

This module contains the methods that the user will use directly to interact with the MapRoulette API.

class maproulette.api.api.Api(config)¶

Class to handle the API requests

create_project(data)¶

Method to create a new project

Parameters

data – the data to use to create the new project

Returns

find_project(matcher='', parent=-1, limit=10, page=0, only_enabled='true')¶

Method to search for projects based on a specific search criteria

Parameters

  • matcher – the search string used to match the project names. Default is empty string

  • parent – the parent ID. This field is ignored for this request. Default is -1.

  • limit – the limit to the number of results returned in the response. Default is 10

  • page – used in conjunction with the limit parameter to page through X number of responses. Default is 0.

  • only_enabled – flag to set if only wanting enabled projects returned. Default is True.

Returns

the response from the API in a list form

get_project_by_id(project_id)¶

Method to fetch a project by unique MapRoulette project ID

Parameters

project_id – the unique project ID

Returns

the response from the API

get_project_by_name(project_name)¶

Method to fetch a project by unique MapRoulette project name

Parameters

project_name – the unique project name

Returns

the response from the API

get_project_challenges(project_id, limit=10, page=0)¶

Method to fetch a list of a project’s challenges.

Parameters

  • project_id – the id of the parent project

  • limit – the limit to the number of results returned in the response. Default is 10

  • page – used in conjunction with the limit parameter to page through X number of responses. Default is 0.

Returns

the response from the API in list form

get_project_children(project_id, limit=10, page=0)¶

Method to fetch a project’s children in an expanded list. Unlike the GET request /project/{id}/challenges, this function will wrap the JSON array list inside of the parent project object, showing the full hierarchy. It will not include the children tasks of the challenges

Parameters

  • project_id – the id of the parent project

  • limit – the limit to the number of results returned in the response. Default is 10

  • page – used in conjunction with the limit parameter to page through X number of responses. Default is 0.

Returns

the response from the API

static is_json(input_object)¶

Method to determine whether user input is valid JSON.

Parameters

input_object – the user’s input to check

Returns

True if valid json object

static is_model(input_object)¶

Method to determine whether user input is a valid project/challenge/task model

Parameters

input_object – the user’s input to check

Returns

True if instance of model

Module: configuration¶

This module contains the basic configuration object that is used to communicate with the MapRoulette API.

class maproulette.api.configuration.Configuration(url='maproulette.org', protocol='https', api_version='/api/v2', api_key=None)¶

Class for storing the configuration of the MapRoulette server

Module: maproulette_server¶

This module contains the basic methods that handle API calls to the MapRoulette API. It uses the requests library to accomplish this.

class maproulette.api.maproulette_server.MapRouletteServer(configuration)¶

Class that holds the basic requests that can be made to the MapRoulette API.

delete(endpoint)¶

Method that completes a DELETE request to the MapRoulette API

Parameters

endpoint – the server endpoint to use for the DELETE request

Returns

a JSON object containing the API response

get(endpoint, params=None)¶

Method that completes a GET request to the MapRoulette API

Parameters

  • endpoint – the server endpoint to use for the GET request

  • params – the parameters that pertain to the request (optional)

Returns

a JSON object containing the API response

post(endpoint, body=None)¶

Method that completes a POST request to the MapRoulette API

Parameters

  • endpoint – the server endpoint to use for the POST request

  • body – the body of the request (optional)

Returns

a JSON object containing the API response

put(endpoint, body=None)¶

Method that completes a PUT request to the MapRoulette API

Parameters

  • endpoint – the server endpoint to use for the PUT request

  • body – the body of the request (optional)

Returns

a JSON object containing the API response
